newsitem.title: POLAND: Two Polish consortia earmarked for TV licences.
newsitem.headline: Two Polish consortia earmarked for TV licences.

text.p: Poland's electronic media watchdog, the National Radio and Television Council (KRRiT), tentatively aprroved regional television licences on Tuesday for two domestic constortia, PAP news agency reported.
PAP quoted KRRiT member Witold Grabos as saying that consortium TVN, led by Poland's multimedia group ITI-Group, would get a licence to broadcast in northen Poland.

The licence to operate in central and eastern Poland would go to the consortium Nasza Telewizja (Our Television) led by Polish business people Henryk Chodysz, Iwona Buechner and January Goscimski, Grabos said.
KRRiT will officially grant the licence by the end of the year after consultations with the telecommunication ministry.

ITI, whose group lost the race for a nationwide broadcasting licence in 1994 to the Polsat broadcasting company, plans a private placement to raise $35 million in part to develop television operations.
